intro: Bothriocline richardsiae, commonly known as the Richardsia borer, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a disc-like structure, typical of the family. It thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often found in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
